content: 1 the austin socks pattern by kay litton an easy textured sock pattern perfect to show off a speckled yarn or use with a solid to really have the texture pop the austin socks -- crazy sock lady designs -- kay litton -- not for commercial use for help or questions please email kay at crazysockladydesigns@gmail com 2 supply list yarn 1 skein of fingering weight yarn 438 yds/100grams yarn used in sock pictured is woolfiendd hand-dyed yarns available on etsy pure bfl base - mother of dragons colorway needles size us 1 / 2 25mm needles gauge 7 5-8 stitches per inch in stockinette stitch notions stitch marker tapestry needle for weaving in ends key st - stitch k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 stitches together p2tog purl 2 stitches together ssk slip slip knit slip 2 stitches together knitwise one at a time then knit together through the back loop sl slip_stitch purlwise with yarn in back *unless otherwise noted the austin socks -- crazy sock lady designs -- kay litton -- not for commercial use for help or questions please email kay at crazysockladydesigns@gmail com 3 instructions pattern is written for small medium large cuff co 56 64 72 stitches work k2 p2 ribbing for 20 rounds or your preferred length continue on to patterned section patterned section round 1 2 k all stitches round 3 *k6 p2* repeat around round 4 k all stitches round 5 *k6 p2* repeat around round 6 k all stitches round 7 *k6 p2* repeat around round 8 9 k all stitches round 10 *k2 p2 k4* repeat around round 11 k all stitches round 12 *k2 p2 k4* repeat around round 13 k all stitches round 14 *k2 p2 k4* repeat around repeat row 1-14 three more times then repeat row 1-8 once this will give you a total of 64 row for the leg **if you wish to do a shorter or longer leg that is perfectly fine just do the length you prefer remembering to mark which row you ended on so that you can pick up with the pattern after you finish your heel the austin socks -- crazy sock lady designs -- kay litton -- not for commercial use for help or questions please email kay at crazysockladydesigns@gmail com 4 slip_stitch heel flap your heel flap will be worked flat across half of your total stitches 28 32 36 row 1 *sl 1 k1* repeat across row row 2 sl 1 with yarn in front purl across row repeat these two row a total of 14 16 18 times this will give you a total of 28 32 36 row heel turn row 1 sl 1 k 14 16 18 ssk k1 turn row 2 sl 1 p 3 p2tog p1 turn row 3 s1 1 k to 1 st before gap ssk k1 turn row 4 sl 1 p to 1 st before gap p2tog p1 turn *do not sl first stitch on very
